info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 07 at 2:36PM EDT until July 07 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN GREENVILLE AND NORTHEASTERN PICKENS COUNTIES... At 236 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northwest of Downtown Greenville, or near Slater-Marietta, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Berea, Travelers Rest, Slater-Marietta, Paris Mountain State Park, Tigerville, Lake Robinson, Cherrydale Point, Furman University, Dacusville and Welcome. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Brief damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines over small areas. A brief period of large hail is also possible. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
